nuke-desc:
{{desc|name=Nuke|url=https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Nuke}}
The Nuke extension allows for sysops to delete a large number of pages ("Mass delete").
nuke-defaultreason:
Reason for deletion in logs. {{msg-mw|nuke-multiplepeople}} is used when pages created by multiple people are deleted.

Parameters:
* $1 - a username or IP address
nuke-defaultreason-tempaccount: Reason for deletion in logs, when pages created by one or more temp accounts were deleted; available when temp accounts and CheckUser are enabled.
nuke-multiplepeople:
Reason for deletion in logs, when pages created by multiple users were deleted.

{{msg-mw|nuke-defaultreason}} is used when pages created by only 1 user are deleted.
nuke-tools: Used as intro text for the Nuke (mass deletion) form.
nuke-tools-tempaccount: Used as intro text for the Nuke (mass deletion) form; available when temp accounts and CheckUser are enabled.
nuke-tools-prompt:
Instructions to show to the user in the 'prompt/list' part of Special:Nuke.

"Continue" is {{msg-mw|Nuke-submit-continue}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|nuke-tools-confirm}}
nuke-tools-confirm:
Instructions to show to the user in the 'confirm' part of Special:Nuke.

"Delete" is {{msg-mw|Nuke-submit-delete}}.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|nuke-tools-confirm}}
nuke-submit-list: The 'List pages' submission button used to generate a list of pages. "List" is a verb here.
nuke-submit-continue: The 'Continue' submission button to move on to the 'confirm 'part of Special:Nuke.
nuke-submit-delete: The 'Delete' submission button to delete the selected pages.
nuke-userorip: Used as label for "target" input box.
nuke-maxpages: Used as label for "nuke limit" input box.
nuke-editby:
This message is followed by {{msg-mw|Comma-separator}} and {{msg-mw|Nuke-viewchanges}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a username
nuke-delete-summary:
Used at the top of the Nuke (mass deletion) result page. Shown when a username was not provided.

Parameters:
* $1 - the number of pages queued for deletion

See also:
* {{msg-mw|nuke-delete-summary-user}}
nuke-delete-summary-user:
Used at the top of the Nuke (mass deletion) result page. Shown when a username was provided.

Parameters:
* $1 - the number of pages queued for deletion
* $2 - the username of the user targeted for deletion

See also:
* {{msg-mw|nuke-delete-summary}}
nuke-deleted:
Used as success result of deletion. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Nuke-not-deleted}}
nuke-deletion-queued:
Used when the page is queued for deletion. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Nuke-deleted}}
nuke-not-deleted:
Used as failure result of deletion. Parameters:
* $1 - page title
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Nuke-deleted}}
nuke-skipped-summary:
Used at the middle (or bottom) of the Nuke (mass deletion) result page. Shown only when some pages were not selected when mass deleting.

Parameters:
* $1 - the number of pages queued for deletion

See also: 
*{{msg-mw|nuke-skipped}}
nuke-delete-more: Used at the bottom of the Nuke (mass deletion) result page.
nuke-pattern: {{doc-important|Do not translate LIKE, it is an SQL operator.}} Used as label for "nuke pattern" input box.
nuke-pattern-performance: Used as a help message for the "nuke pattern" input box. Indicates the maximum age allowed by recent changes. Parameters: * $1 - the time period of Special:RecentChange's max age (e.g. "30 days", "24 hours 0 minutes"), as provided by Language::formatTimePeriod.
nuke-namespace: Label shown on [[Special:Nuke]] in front of the namespace input that allows choosing namespaces to filter the search by
nuke-namespace-noscript: Additional instructions for how to properly type in namespaces for those with JavaScript disabled
nuke-linkoncontribs:
Used as link text which is used on [[Special:Contributions]] and [[Special:DeletedContributions]].

Only added if a user has rights to nuke pages.

The link has the tooltip {{msg-mw|Nuke-linkoncontribs-text}}.
{{Identical|Mass delete}}
nuke-linkoncontribs-text:
Tooltip for the link which is labeled {{msg-mw|Nuke-linkoncontribs}} Parameters:
* $1 is the target username used for GENDER.
tag-nuke:
Short description of the nuke tag.

Shown on lists of changes (history, recentchanges, etc.) for each page deleted with the Nuke extension.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|tag-nuke-description}}
tag-nuke-description:
Long description of the nuke tag.

Shown on [[Special:Tags]].

See also:
* {{msg-mw|tag-nuke}}
